title: Infrequent Commit cycles, 20 - 120 min behind chain tip
body:
Hey guys
Has anyone experienced the infrequent Commit cycles (see the log below) and lagging behind the chain tip?
Tried both stable and devel branches. 

#### System information

Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8700 CPU @ 3.20GHz 
12 Core
128GB RAM

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
2.42.0-stable-d8d04663

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Linux 5.17.0

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
/home/max/erigon_devel/build/bin/erigon --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --datadir=/home/max/.local/share/erigon   --torrent.download.rate=60mb --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace --snapshots=true --chain=mainnet

Concensus Layer: Erigon

Chain/Network:  mainnet

#### Expected behaviour

Erigon keeping up with the chain

#### Actual behaviour

```

something wrong with headers downloading:
```
 [2/15 Headers] DONE                      in=4m48.39174493s
```

I am having this same problem for the past several weeks, so using Erigon has become painful and I am really hoping for a fix. Something is wrong with the light client. Solving this issue might also solve all the other related issues to this one: 7269, 7173, 7077, 7036,  and more. Something to point out, is that the LightClient P2P peers count is variable. See above: 6 peers then 2. Sometimes it varies like this for me, but it used to work perfectly before a few weeks ago.

Last week, the node would get "stuck" for many hours until I restarted it, and then it would stay up to date for a while. This week, it does this cycle as described above, staying 10-120 minutes behind. It does not stay up to date after it finally discovers headers, and the cycle happens again.

Other user reported something similar: 
```

[message.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/11260085/message.txt)
@MaximusDecimus do you use internal or external ConsensusLayer?

> something wrong with headers downloading:
> 
> ```
>  [2/15 Headers] DONE                      in=4m48.39174493s
> ```

Network issue?
@MaximusDecimus we don't know yet. 1 team-member did try to debug/bisect but haven't succeed yet.
Can we fix it by rolling back the version? @AskAlexSharov
